In addition to its focus on fundamental perceptions and cognitive processes, music psychology is a field of research with practical relevance for many areas, including music ,, ,, ,, ,, and ,, as well as investigations of human ,, skill, ,, creativity, and ,.
, of music is the scientific study of brain-based mechanisms involved in the cognitive processes underlying music. These behaviours include music listening, performing, composing, reading, writing, and ancillary activities. It also is increasingly concerned with the brain basis for musical aesthetics and musical emotion. The field is distinguished by its reliance on direct observations of the brain, using such techniques as , (fMRI), , (TMS), , (MEG), , (EEG), and , (PET).
